articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao High-Ranking Youth Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao High-Ranking Youth Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with a high-ranking youth delegation of Laos headed by Sonethanou Thammavong, secretary of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union, which paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from C.C., Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from C.C., Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union.
					 The gift was handed over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday by Sonethanou Thammavong, secretary of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union, who is heading a Lao high-ranking youth delegation on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Support and Solidarity Expressed for DPRK at Recent Int'l Conferences
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Support and Solidarity Expressed for DPRK at Recent Int'l Conferences
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Wednesday as regards the fact that support and solidarity were expressed for the DPRK at the recent major international conferences:
					The 17th NAM summit held on the Margarita Island in Venezuela on Sept. 17 and 18 on the theme of "peace, sovereignty and solidarity for development" adopted a final document and Margarita Declaration reflecting the shared stand of the member nations.
					
					The final document denounced military exercises for aggression and use of arms and threats against sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence of member nations of the NAM as a wanton violation of principles of the UN Charter and an act of aggression.
					
					The document expressed serious concern over resolutions on sanctions adopted by the UN Security Council against NAM member nations as they lacked appropriate legal ground and disregarded impartiality and justice, and rejected acts of negating or encroaching upon the right to develop and use space for peaceful purposes, the legitimate rights of sovereign states.
					
					Also specified in the document were stand of opposing and rejecting special rapporteur system that highlights politicization, double-standards and selectivity in handling human rights issues.
					
					At the G-77 ministerial meeting held on the sidelines of the 71st UN General Assembly, a declaration rejecting the unilateral sanctions against the DPRK and demanding the immediate lifting of them was made public.
					
					The recent adoption of the final document at the NAM summit and the publication of the declaration at the G-77 ministerial meeting mean rebuff and opposition of the unprecedented moves for isolating and stifling the DPRK being pressed for by the U.S. and its followers by more than a hundred countries holding majority of the UN member nations.
					
					This is also an expression of legitimate stand of the international community aspiring after independence and justice and a reflection of full support and solidarity with the cause of the Korean people under the prevailing international situation where international justice is wantonly violated due to high-handed and arbitrary practices of big powers.
					
					The international support and solidarity greatly encourage the Korean people in their struggle to protect the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the international peace and security from the U.S. and its followers' increased nuclear threat and blackmail and harsh sanctions and blockade.
					
					We will as ever boost solidarity and cooperation with the NAM member nations and developing countries in the efforts to build a new independent world and realize genuine international justice.

articles.title: Kim Yong Dae Meets Delegation of World Communion of Reformed Churches
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae Meets Delegation of World Communion of Reformed Churches
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with a delegation of the World Communion of Reformed Churches led by President Jerry Pillay which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Closes
articles.content:
Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Closes
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 10th International Science and Technology Book Fair closed with due ceremony at the Sci-Tech Complex on Wednesday.
					Present at the closing ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, teachers, researchers, delegations and delegates of foreign countries, international bodies and overseas Koreans and foreign diplomatic envoys here.
					
					Certificates were awarded to the units which donated books and materials they presented to the fair.
					
					A letter to supreme leader Kim Jong Un was adopted.
					
					Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the organizing committee of the book fair, in her closing address said during the fair scientific and technical achievements of different countries were widely introduced and the participants exchanged experience in diverse fields.
					
					She expressed the will to boost scientific and technological exchange and cooperation with various countries in the future, too.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Int'l Book Fair
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Int'l Book Fair
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the participants in the 10th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair on Wednesday.
					 The letter said the book fair was successfully held true to its goal and mission thanks to the sincere efforts and cooperation of foreign organizations, international bodies.
					
					 The Sci-Tech Complex, study center for all people, and the Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair held there clearly proved the distinguished insight of Kim Jong Un and the vitality of the DPRK government's policy of prioritizing science and technology, the letter said.
					
					 It expressed sincere thanks to Kim Jong Un for his deep attention and loving care shown for the book fair and belief that the DPRK would rank itself among the world science and technology powers in the near future under his leadership.
					
					 The participants will continue conducting brisk science and technology exchange and cooperation through the Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair in the future, too, the letter added.

articles.title: National Korean Dress Show Opens
articles.content:
National Korean Dress Show Opens
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 14th national show of Korean dress opened with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall on Wednesday.
					 The show was held under the theme of "The best Korean dress in the world".
					
					 On display are more than 1,100 pieces of men's and women's Korean dresses and seasonal dresses such as casuals, gala dresses, wedding dresses and children's dresses presented by technicians and skilled workers of factories in the field of garment industry and tailor's shops, and members of the women's union.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Il Ryong, minister of Light Industry, Jo Yong Chol, minister of Food and Consumer Goods Industries, Kim Kyong Nam, minister of Commerce, and Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, who doubles as vice-chairmen of the Korean Dress Society, officials concerned, officials, scientists and technicians, workers of units which presented their products to the show and members of the women's union.
					
					  A fashion show took place at the ceremony.
					
					  The dress show would involve a workshop on the advantages of Korean dresses, features of their varieties, methods of tailoring and making Korean trousers and jackets and garment technology book service.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Personage
articles.content:
Participants in 10th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 10th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair Wednesday visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary career of the President who devoted himself to the struggle for the prosperity of the country and people's happiness and the accomplishment of global independence and on his family members in Mangyongdae, they looked round historical relics preserved with much care.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Gifts from Russian and Chinese Businessmen
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Gifts from Russian and Chinese Businessmen
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received gifts from Roman Yuriyevich Samokhin, general manager of      Almagest Co. Ltd in Russia, and Liu Fulin, managing director of the Golden Monkey Group Co. Ltd in China.
					 The gifts were conveyed to DPRK ambassadors to the relevant countries on Sept. 12 and 23.

articles.title: Lao High-Ranking Youth Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Lao High-Ranking Youth Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking youth delegation of Laos headed by Sonethanou Thammavong, secretary of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being told about the revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and patriotic lives of his family members at his time-honored old home in Mangyongdae, members of the delegation went round historical relics preserved with much care.
					
					 The delegation toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Museum of Weapons and Equipment of the Korean People's Army, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, etc.

articles.title: Material Assistance for Flood-hit Areas Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Material Assistance for Flood-hit Areas Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- South Phyongan and North Hwanghae provinces of the DPRK are taking active part in rendering material assistance to the flood-hit areas of the country's North Hamgyong Province, in hearty response to the appealing call of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 A campaign is going on to boost production at electric power, coal and cement production bases in South Phyongan Province. The province has sent to those areas a large amount of building materials, food grain, clothes and daily necessities.
					
					 North Hwanghae Province also rendered a great deal of aids, including foodstuff, grains, 1.5 million pieces of daily necessities, steel, cement and wood.

articles.title: Transport Ships Leave for Flood-hit Areas
articles.content:
Transport Ships Leave for Flood-hit Areas
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Transport ships loading cement leave Nampho City for the flood-hit areas of North Hamgyong Province, the DPRK one after another.
					 The city conducted a 3 day-long campaign to finish packing and shipment of cement and sent the first ship some days ago, while directing big efforts to packing and shipping cement in close cooperation with relevant units.
					
					 Nampho Port also pays big attention to supplying fuel and accessories in time to put wharf cranes and other facilities in full operation.
					
					 On Sept. 24, transport ship Kwangmyong set sail from the port.

articles.title: U.S., Worst Human Rights Abuser
articles.content:
U.S., Worst Human Rights Abuser
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A demonstration continues in Charlotte City of North Carolina State, the United States in protest against the fatal police shooting at an unarmed black man. This shows the true color of the U.S. as the worst human rights abuser on the brink of ruin.
					 Dr. Kim Tong Ha of Kim Il Sung University who is an expert on international affairs said this in an interview with KCNA.
					
					 It is ridiculous that the U.S behaves itself as "human rights judge" in international arena, instead of worrying about its worst human rights records, he said, and continued:
					
					 Under the pretext of "war on terrorism", the U.S. has bombed at its own judgment any place of the world, whether it was a wedding place or hospital, killing many people, irrespective of the sovereignty of the lesser nations and rights of civilians.
					
					 Therefore, the UN high commissioner for Human Rights denounced the atrocities committed by the U.S. forces as war crimes to be brought before the military tribunal. And Chinese experts on international affairs said that the refugee crisis would have been unthinkable without military interference of the U.S. and Western countries in the Middle East.
					
					 Such being a hard fact, the U.S. is making desperate effort to preserve its position as the "only superpower" from sinking by sitting the countries disagreeable to its feeling in the "dock at a human rights tribunal".
					
					 A department director of the Russian Foreign Ministry said that double standards in dealing human rights issue disturbs the cooperation and dialogue, adding that Russia will fight against double standards, politicization of human rights issue and abuse of human rights issue aiming at interfering in others' internal affairs.
					
					 The persistent U.S. "human rights racket" against the DPRK will lead to its self-destruction.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. and S. Korean Regime's Scenario for Preemptive Nuclear Strike
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts U.S. and S. Korean Regime's Scenario for Preemptive Nuclear Strike
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean puppet regime have entered the phase of implementing an extremely dangerous scenario for mounting a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK.
					 On Sept. 19 the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime decided to make the "three-phase tailored deterrence strategy" go over to an actual OPLAN to strike the nuclear facilities of the DPRK from the phase of conception and formally agreed to carry it out.
					
					 It was reported that the OPLAN would be elaborated at the U.S.-south Korea "annual security consultative meeting" to be held in October so that it may be applied to actual conditions.
					
					 This is a virtual declaration of a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK with all type war means including nukes involved.
					
					 Originally the strategy touted by the enemies is a nuclear war scenario calling for a preemptive strike at the DPRK with all military means including nukes involved if the DPRK shows even a slight sign of using nukes or missiles.
					
					 The scenario was officially adopted at the 45th U.S.-south Korea "annual security consultative meeting" held in Seoul in October 2013 and has been applied to joint military exercises since 2014 but it is the first time that the specific contents of the phased scenario of this strategy were disclosed.
					
					 Pursuant to the above-said three-phase strategy, they set about implementing a nuclear war scenario in actuality in view of the dramatically escalating tensions on the Korean peninsula. Herein lies the danger of the scenario.
					
					 The U.S. staged madcap firepower strike rehearsals of various forms under the simulated conditions of actual battle against the DPRK by openly introducing strategic nuclear carrier to waters off south Korea and letting strategic nuclear bombers fly in the air over it as part of the preparations for carrying out this war scenario with the involvement of triad strategic nuclear strike means. By doing so, the U.S. has made overall arrangements for the preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK and modified, supplemented and rounded off them. 
					
					 Of late it let two B-1B strategic nuclear bombers take off the Andersen Air Base on Guam and make shuttle flights in the air over south Korea along the Military Demarcation Line for the exercise of dropping nuclear bombs.
					
					 One of them was deployed in the U.S. Osan Air Force Base and Ronald Reagan nuclear carrier task force is sailing to the waters off the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers are also openly blustering that the proposal for making a preemptive attack on the north's nuclear capability by use of precision guided weapons will be put into practice and that they will take high-profile actions to cope with the nuclear threat from the north by using effective and powerful means.
					
					 Their nuclear offensive plans aiming at a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK have reached the phase of their implementation, increasing the danger of a nuclear war on the peninsula and in the region day by day.
					
					 The prevailing situation proves once again that the DPRK was absolutely just when it opted for bolstering up its nuclear deterrence in every way under the banner of the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers' implementation of their scenario for preemptive nuclear strike is an extremely dangerous gambling risking their lives.
					
					 If the U.S. attempts to mount a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK, the U.S. mainland and other bases for aggression will face a merciless retaliatory strike of the Korean People's Army before it is made.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group keen on prolonging their remaining days under the patronage of the U.S. will have to pay a high price for being involved in the attempt.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Demands S. Korean Puppet Authorities Stop Nuclear Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Demands S. Korean Puppet Authorities Stop Nuclear Racket against DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The anti-DPRK nuclear racket of the south Korean puppet regime is the root cause of bringing the inter-Korean relations to a collapse and the escalating tension between the north and the south, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 The article cites facts to condemn the puppet regime for going reckless in the confrontation campaign against the fellow countrymen in the north, groundlessly pulling up it over its nuclear warhead explosion test for self-defence.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Their ridiculous campaign is nothing but a cynical ploy to justify their anachronistic policy of confrontation and realize their wild ambition to "force the north to dismantle its nukes" by soliciting cooperation in putting international pressure on the DPRK.
					
					 It is entirely attributable to the Park regime's vicious anti-DPRK nuclear racket that tension persists on the Korean peninsula and the north-south relations are driven into the uncontrollable phase of catastrophe.
					
					 The inter-Korean ties have not improved but the confrontation has escalated despite the DPRK's positive efforts to warm the ties and all the fellow countrymen's struggle. This is an inevitable consequence entailed by the reckless anti-reunification confrontational actions of the Park regime to "pressurize the north to dismantle its nukes".
					
					 They have been busy with diplomacy towards foreign forces in a bid to solicit cooperation in the confrontation with the DPRK, turning down its goodwill proposal for warming the inter-Korean ties under the motto of "the north's denuclearization first and the start of dialogue next."
					
					 Due to their reckless confrontation actions every opportunity of dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south won thanks to the DPRK's patriotic sincere efforts was scuppered and even the Kaesong industrial zone, the last symbol of north-south cooperation, ceased to operate.
					
					 The puppet regime's moves to deploy THAAD brought to light its true colors as traitors unhesitatingly doing harm to the dignity and destiny of the nation, tightening the military nexus with the U.S. in its scenario for invading the DPRK under the pretext of "nuclear threat from the north".
					
					 The Park regime would be well advised to stop running wild, properly understanding the sky-high spirit of the nuclear giant in the East and the trend of the times.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Military Nexus with Japan
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Military Nexus with Japan 
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Talks between the diplomatic chiefs of south Korea and Japan took place in New York recently. At the talks, south Korean puppet Minister of Foreign Affairs Yun Pyong Se together with his Japanese counterpart Kishida malignantly slandered the DPRK's steps for bolstering up its nuclear deterrence as "frequent and high-profile provocations" and "unprecedented threat." They were closeted over the issue of "boosting cooperation in handling the nuclear issue of the north", "proposal for strong defensive action to put pressure upon the north" and "cooperation in the field of security".
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary terms this an unpardonable criminal action to stifle the compatriots in the north in conspiracy with Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation.
					
					 It is an inveterate bad habit of the south Korean puppet forces, sycophants towards outside forces, to join hands with anyone in a bid to do harm to the compatriots in the north and realize their ambition to invade it.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group of traitors are putting spurs to tightening the military nexus with Japan under the pretext of "coping with the "nuclear and missile threats from the north". This is prompted by their sinister intention to hurt the DPRK by force of arms at any cost with the backing of its master Japan.
					
					 The above-said action stepped up by the Park regime despite the unanimous domestic and foreign denunciation amounts to a hideous criminal act of paving the Japanese militarists' way of launching reinvasion to realize the old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere".
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the puppet forces' tightened military nexus with Japan would escalate the tension on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia and bring about dark clouds of a nuclear war.
					
					 This is a clear proof that the Park group are the thrice-cursed pro-Japanese lackeys with whom the Koreans can never live under the same sky.
					
					 They can never escape from a miserable end owing to the countless crimes they have committed against the country and the nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Leading Papers Accuse U.S. of Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
DPRK's Leading Papers Accuse U.S. of Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is entirely to blame for pushing the situation on the Korean peninsula to the uncontrollable danger of the outbreak of a nuclear war, say DPRK's leading newspapers on Wednesday in their commentaries. 
					 Reminding its readers of the actions taken by the U.S. against the DPRK, Rodong Sinmun notes that the U.S. introduced strategic nuclear bombers into the southern part of the peninsula to make a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Supposing that when the U.S. carried out a sub-critical nuclear test and an ICBM test-fire, a nuclear weapons state forward-deploys latest nuclear strike means in an area close to the U.S. territory and openly stages military drills targeting U.S. main facilities under the pretext of defending peace for the purpose of protecting a friendly non-nuclear weapons state, is it acceptable to the U.S.?
					
					 The U.S. senselessly made fuss in the Caribbean Sea extremely escalating the tension there when the Soviet Union forward-deployed nuclear missiles in Cuba in 1962.
					
					 It is illogical for the U.S. to claim that other country's nuclear weapons deployed in an area near the U.S. mainland are a threat to peace whereas U.S. nuclear weapons deployed in the southern part of the Korean peninsula are for defending peace.
					
					 The escalating tension on the peninsula will finally lead to a nuclear war and the prevailing situation is almost close to its brink.
					
					 Minju Joson says that the U.S. is reeling off a string of sophism to label the DPRK as a "disturber of peace" by terming the DPRK's self-defensive counteractions "provocations", but it is nothing but a poor artifice to conceal the aggressive nature and evade the responsibility for the escalating tension.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Warmongers' Attempt at Preemptive Nuclear Strike at DPRK Will Only Precipitate Their Self-Ruin
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Warmongers' Attempt at Preemptive Nuclear Strike at DPRK Will Only Precipitate Their Self-Ruin
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces openly blustered that they would officially apply the "three-phase tailored deterrent strategy" to make a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK while claiming that the DPRK's successful nuclear warhead explosion test "made its nuclear threat" potential.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says in a commentary this is little short of a declaration of a nuclear war as they threatened to make a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 They are working hard to put into practice the phased war strategy to make a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK while pulling up it over its self-defensive measures, labeling them "threat" and "provocation".
					
					 The DPRK has already clarified that it would not be the first to use nuclear weapons unless the hostile forces for aggression encroach upon its sovereignty and urged the U.S. to exercise prudence and self-restraint.
					
					 The DPRK would like to warn the brigandish U.S. imperialists and the Park Geun Hye group of traitors once again that they should not forget even a moment the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK are fully ready to go into a decisive action to thoroughly contain the reckless military moves of the aggressors and provocateurs to carry out their "scenario for preemptive nuclear strike at the north".
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces should stop acting rashly, bearing in mind the warnings of the DPRK that the only way for the U.S. to escape the deadly strikes of the infuriated Korean People's Army is to exercise prudence and self-restraint, refraining from encroaching upon the dignity and security of the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Navy Stage Exercise for Ground Offensives against DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Navy Stage Exercise for Ground Offensives against DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers made desperate efforts to stage a naval drill aimed at ground offensives against the DPRK in the East Sea of Korea on Sept. 26, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Involved there were U.S. and the puppet navy's guided missile destroyer, Aegis destroyer and other warships, sea-patrol plane and antisubmarine helicopters.
					
					 The warmongers kicked off exercises to make a precision strike at the DPRK's ground targets with missiles mounted on warships and tactical mobile and antisubmarine exercises.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Group's Attempt to Make Autopsy of Corpse Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Group's Attempt to Make Autopsy of Corpse Slammed
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Catholic Priests' Council for Justice issued a statement on Sept. 27 disclosing the sinister intention of the puppet group to make an autopsy of the dead body of peasant Paek Nam Gi who was killed due to the authorities' brutal crackdown.
					 It said that the death of the peasant was caused by water cannon of the police which was confirmed by the photography and records of operation at the hospital at that time.

articles.title: There Is No Place for Deploying THAAD: S. Korean Social Bodies
articles.content:
There Is No Place for Deploying THAAD: S. Korean Social Bodies
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A peace action to oppose the deployment of THAAD in south Korea was held in front of the building of the puppet Ministry of Defence on Sept. 26 under the sponsorship of the Action for Checking THAAD Deployment in south Korea.
					 It was attended by the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, Ronal Buddhism organizations, etc.
					
					 Referring to the fact that the parliamentary inspection of the administration will be made at the Ministry of Defence that day, the participants said that the problem of the THAAD deployment and its military effectiveness should be thoroughly verified.

articles.title: Helicopter of S. Korean Puppet Army Crashes
articles.content:
Helicopter of S. Korean Puppet Army Crashes
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A helicopter of the south Korean puppet army fell into the East Sea of Korea during a joint drill with the U.S. imperialist aggression forces on September 26, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 It was reported that it went missing after sending SOS eight minutes after its lift-off.

articles.title: S. Korean Trade Unions Launch General Strikes in Succession
articles.content:
S. Korean Trade Unions Launch General Strikes in Succession
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- South Korean workers went on general strikes in succession in protest against the puppet authorities' unpopular policy of mercilessly trampling down the vital rights of the workers.
					 The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea declared a general strike with public and financial trade unions as its pivot on Sept. 21.
					
					On Sept. 23 the financial trade union launched a general strike after holding a rally with the attendance of more than 50,000 workers and the next day the freight workers' solidarity went on a general strike in protest against the authorities' anti-worker policy of meeting only the interests of big businesses.
					
					 On September 26 the trade union of Hyundai Motors went on a general strike in protest against the management's unjust attitude towards the wage negotiations.
					
					 The trade union of the hospital of Seoul National University also launched a strike.

articles.title: Struggle of S. Korean Workers for Right to Existence Supported
articles.content:
Struggle of S. Korean Workers for Right to Existence Supported
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting of 100,000 financial and public workers for pledging an all-out action and a rally for the general strike with the attendance of more than 50,000 workers in Seoul, south Korea in June and on September 23 respectively, in protest against the Park Geun Hye group's unpopular labor policies like the system of paying salaries according to piece rate.
					 In this regard, Kim Han Il, manager of the Chollima Steel Complex, in an interview with KCNA said:
					
					 The struggle of the south Korean workers is daily getting stronger, as the Park Geun Hye group's move for the retrogressive revision of the labor law poses a serious threat to their right to existence.
					
					 The "system for salaries according piece rate" pushed forward by the south Korean puppet group is an inhuman and unpopular modern-version slave system to legalize and justify the harsh exploitation of workers.
					
					 During the "presidential election", traitor Park Geun Hye made such honeyed commitments as "the world where the workers lead a happy life" in a bid to seize power, but after her assumption of office, she has pursued unpopular policies which are good only for the rich.
					
					 The enforcement of the system will be resulted in snowballing the number of the jobless which stands at over 4.5 million.
					
					 Therefore, it is quite natural for the south Korean workers to turn out in the general strike, branding the system as the "system of forcible retirement" and "modern-version slave system".
					
					 The harsher suppression and dictatorship will only invite the stronger resistance.
					
					 The south Korean workers will surely emerge victorious in the struggle for their right to existence.

articles.title: Statement of Spokesman for KPA General Staff Supported by Swiss Bodies
articles.content:
Statement of Spokesman for KPA General Staff Supported by Swiss Bodies
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on Sept. 22 supporting the statement made by a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 Recalling that the KPA General Staff spokesman in a statement warned the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces of miserable consequences, the statement said:
					
					 The final goal sought by the U.S. imperialists and the Park Geun Hye group of pro-U.S. traitors in their on-going reckless racket of tightening military pressure upon the DPRK is a "regime change in the north" through "elimination" of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 KPA's nuclear strike will reduce Seoul where Chongwadae and other reactionary ruling machines are located, the citadel of confrontation with the compatriots in the north, to ashes.
					
					 If the U.S. continues letting B-1Bs fly in the sky above Korea to escalate military provocation, the KPA will remove Guam, the base of provocation, from the earth.
					
					 The only way for the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces to escape the annihilating strike by the enraged KPA is to exercise prudence and self-restraint, refraining from infringing upon the dignity and security of the DPRK.
					
					 We fully support the warning served by the KPA General Staff and the tough stand of the powerful Paektusan army to counter the provocation of Yankee aggressors.

articles.title: 16th Congress of Women's International Democratic Federation Supports Korean People
articles.content:
16th Congress of Women's International Democratic Federation Supports Korean People
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 16th Congress of the Women's International Democratic Federation (WIDF) held in Bogota, Colombia from September 14 to 18 expressed the support and solidarity with the just cause of the Korean people.
					 Marcia de Campos Pereira, president of the WIDF, in her key report at the plenary meeting expressed the belief that the WIDF will extend invariable support to the struggle of the Korean people including women against the U.S. sanctions.
					
					 A resolution in support of the just cause of the Korean people including women was adopted on September 17.
					
					 Noting that the U.S. upset by the DPRK's measures for bolstering up self-defensive military muscle is running amuck with sanctions and nuclear war drills, the resolution said:
					
					 The WIDF condemns the U.S. heinous hostile policy toward the DPRK reflecting the unanimous will of progressives who love justice and peace and solemnly declares as follows:
					
					1. The U.S. should face up to the strategic position of the DPRK and the trend of the times and withdraw its anachronistic hostile policy toward it, replace the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty and pull the aggression forces and war equipment out of south Korea.
					
					2. The U.S. should lift sanctions to stifle the DPRK and stop inciting the south Korean authorities to confrontation with the fellow countrymen and take its hands off the issue of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					3. Invariable is the stand of the WIDF struggling to build a new just, peaceful and independent world free from domination, subjugation, aggression and interference.
					
					 The WIDF extends full support to the struggle of the Korean people including women for achieving national reunification by the concerted efforts of the nation without interference by outside forces.
					
					 The final declaration reflecting the above-said resolution was adopted at the Congress.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of WPK Observed by Peruvian Parties
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of WPK Observed by Peruvian Parties
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting of Peruvian political parties in Lima on September 21 to observe the 71st founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 On display at the venue of the meeting were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present there were members of leadership and members of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students, the Revolutionary Socialist Party and other parties of Peru.
					
					 The chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru said the WPK has performed great exploits, adding the DPRK has turned into a powerful country independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, possessed of even H-bomb, which the U.S. styling itself the "only superpower" dares not provoke.
					
					 All successes achieved by the DPRK are the valuable fruition of the wise leadership of the great leaders, he noted.
					
					 The general secretary of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru and other personages warmly congratulated the WPK on its 71st founding anniversary.
					
					 Heroism and indomitable spirit being displayed by the Korean people in the struggle for defending the sovereignty of the country, dignity of the nation and socialism are the models the progressive people in the world should learn from.

articles.title: DPRK's Access to Nukes Is Objective and Practical Fact: UK Figure
articles.content:
DPRK's Access to Nukes Is Objective and Practical Fact: UK Figure
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The existence of the DPRK's nuclear weapons does not change even though others do not recognize it. The DPRK's access to nukes is the objective and practical fact.
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, said this in an article contributed to the newspaper The New Worker on Sept. 23.
					
					 The article said that the DPRK conducted the nuclear warhead explosion test.
					
					 The test powerfully demonstrated again the might of the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state, the article noted.
					
					 Nevertheless, U.S. President Obama blustered he would never recognize the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state, behaving foolishly, it pointed out.
					
					 Though Obama takes additional countermeasures while blustering he would not recognize the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state, he cannot arrest the DPRK from advancing, it said.
					
					 In fact, sanctions would further strengthen the self-development principle of the Korean people, it noted.
					
					 Obama does not recognize the DPRK's access to nukes but continues pursuing the hostile policy toward the latter, driving the U.S. into nuclear disaster, it said, adding: Korea will be reunified under the leadership of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un before long.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion juvenil de alto nivel de Laos
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion juvenil de alto nivel de Laos

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX se refiere al apoyo a RPDC expresado en reuniones importantes
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX se refiere al apoyo a RPDC expresado en reuniones importantes
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que en las importantes reuniones internacionales, recien celebradas, se expresaron el apoyo y la solidaridad a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia 28 a la ACNC la siguiente respuesta:
					En la XVII Cumbre de los NOAL, transcurrida los dias 17 y 18 en la isla Margarita de Venezuela con el tema de "Paz, soberania y solidaridad para el desarrollo", fueron aprobados el documento final y la Declaracion de Margarita que reflejan la posicion comun de los Paises No Alineados. 
					
					El documento final condeno los ejercicios militares de caracter agresivo, el uso de armas y la amenaza contra la soberania, la integridad territorial y la independencia de los paises miembros del MNOAL calificandolos como acciones de agresion y violacion flagrante de los principios estipulados en la Carta de la ONU. 
					
					Y expreso seria preocupacion por el hecho de que las resoluciones de sancion del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU contra los paises miembros del MNOAL desprecian los justos fundamentos juridicos, la imparcialidad y la justicia, y rechazo los actos que niegan o impiden el desarrollo y uso del cosmos con fines pacificos, legitimo derecho de Estados soberanos. 
					
					Al mismo tiempo, aclaro la posicion contra el sistema de relator especial que causa la politizacion, la pauta de doble rasero y la selectividad en el trato del problema de DDHH. 
					
					Por otra parte, en la reunion ministerial del Grupo-77, efectuada durante la 71a sesion de la Asamblea General de la ONU, fue aprobada una declaracion que rechaza la sancion unilateral contra la RPDC y demanda su levantamiento inmediato. 
					
					El documento final de la Cumbre de los NOAL y la declaracion de la reunion ministerial del Grupo-77 testimonian que ciento y decenas de paises, que ocupan la mayoria de la membresia de la ONU, se oponen a la inaudita campana de aislamiento y aplastamiento anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y sus satelites. 
					
					Este hecho manifiesta la justa posicion de la sociedad internacional, que aspira a la independencia y la justicia en la actual situacion internacional en que se ve pisoteada gravemente la justicia internacional debido al despotismo y arbitrariedades de las potencias, y significa una muestra de apoyo total y solidaridad con la causa de nuestro pueblo. 
					
					El apoyo y solidaridad internacionales dan gran estimulo a nuestro pueblo que lucha por defender la dignidad y la soberania del pais, la paz internacional y la seguridad frente a la recrudescente amenaza y chantaje nucleares y la sucia campana de sancion y bloqueo de EE.UU. y sus satelites. 
					
					En lo adelante tambien, la RPDC fortalecera la unidad y la cooperacion con los Paises No Alienados y los en vias de desarrollo en la lucha por construir un nuevo mundo independiente y por hacer valer la verdadera justicia internacional.

articles.title: Kim Yong Dae se reune con la delegacion eclesiastica extranjera
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae se reune con la delegacion eclesiastica extranjera

articles.title: Clausurada X exposicion internacional de libros de ciencias y tecnicas de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Clausurada X exposicion internacional de libros de ciencias y tecnicas de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 28 en el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas la ceremonia de clausura de la X exposicion internacional de libros de ciencias y tecnicas de Pyongyang. 
					Participaron aqui el vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, los funcionarios interesados, profesores, investigadores, las delegaciones y delegados de varios paises, organizaciones internacionales y de compatriotas residentes en ultramar y los representantes diplomaticos acreditados en Corea. 
					
					En la ceremonia fueron otorgados los diplomas a las entidades exponentes. 
					
					Quedo aprobada una carta dirigida al Presidente Kim Jong Un.
					
					La presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y del comite organizador de la exposicion, Kim Jong Suk, dijo en su discurso de clausura que durante el evento, se presentaron ampliamente los exitos cientifico-tecnicos de varios paises del mundo y se intercambiaron las experiencias adquiridas en diversos dominios. 
					
					Expreso la voluntad de desarrollar mas el intercambio y cooperacion con varios paises del mundo en el sector cientifico-tecnicos.

articles.title: Inaugurada 14a exhibicion nacional de vestimentas coreanas
articles.content:
Inaugurada 14a exhibicion nacional de vestimentas coreanas
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciada la 14a exhibicion nacional de vestimentas coreanas con el tema de "Vestidos nacionales son los mejores del mundo".
					En esta edicion se exhibieron mas de mil 100 vestidos de ambos sexos y para diferentes estaciones del ano, incluyendo las ropas de uso cotidiano, las prendas de gala y bodas y las infantiles, confeccionadas por los tecnicos, obreros calificados e integrantes de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea de las fabricas de la rama y las sastrerias.
					
					Tuvo lugar este miercoles en la Casa Central de la Juventud la ceremonia de inauguracion con la participacion de los vicepresidentes de la Asociacion de Vestido de Corea: el ministro de Industria Ligera Choe Il Ryong, el ministro de Industria Alimentaria y de Articulos de Uso Diario, Jo Yong Chol, el ministro de Comercio Kim Kyong Nam y el ministro de Cultura Pak Chun Nam, y los funcionarios, cientificos, tecnicos, obreros e integrantes de la UMDC de las entidades vinculadas y exponentes. 
					
					Este dia, hubo la muestra de modelos. 
					
					En el marco de la exposicion, se realizaran tambien los cursillos tecnicos y los servicios de libros tecnicos.
